changes.subject: section 2(1)

affectedPillars.reason: The amendment directly affects the process of removal of individuals who have entered or arrived in breach of immigration control.

affectedPillars.reason: The amendment allows for the removal of unaccompanied children from the United Kingdom.

changes.subject: section 4
changes.quote:
The duty in section 2(1) or the power in section 3(2) applies in relation to a person who meets the four conditions in section 2 regardless of whether—
(a) the person makes a protection claim,
(b) the person makes a human rights claim,
(c) the person claims to be a victim of slavery or a victim of human trafficking as defined by regulations made by the Secretary of State under section 69 of the Nationality and Borders Act 2022, or
(d) the person makes an application for judicial review in relation to their removal from the United Kingdom under this Act.
changes.summary: The amendment clarifies that the duty to make arrangements for removal or the power to make arrangements for removal applies regardless of whether the person makes a protection claim, a human rights claim, claims to be a victim of slavery or human trafficking, or makes an application for judicial review.

affectedPillars.name: Immigration
affectedPillars.reason: The amendment clarifies the scope of the duty and power to make arrangements for removal.
